content:
Identify the reaction type based on the given chemical reaction.
2Fe + 3O2 → 2Fe2O3

The given chemical reaction is:

\[ 4Fe + 3O_2 \rightarrow 2Fe_2O_3 \]

This is an example of a **combination reaction** (or synthesis reaction), where two or more reactants combine to form a single product. In this case, iron (Fe) and oxygen (O₂) are combining to form iron(III) oxide (Fe₂O₃). Additionally, it is also a **redox reaction** because it involves the transfer of electrons between the reactants, where iron is oxidized and oxygen is reduced.
